metadata.title: CVE-2021-47336 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:smackfs: restrict bytes count in smk_set_cipso() Oops, I failed to updatesubject line. From 07571157c91b98ce1a4aa70967531e64b78e8346 Mon Sep 1700:00:00 2001 Date: Mon, 12 Apr 2021 22:25:06 +0900 Subject: [PATCH]smackfs: restrict bytes count in smk_set_cipso() Commit 7ef4c19d245f3dc2("smackfs: restrict bytes count in smackfs write functions") missed thatcount > SMK_CIPSOMAX check applies to only format == SMK_FIXED24_FMT case.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47336` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1069-fips - 4.15.0-1069.78
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1069-fips - 4.15.0-1069.78
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1069-fips - 4.15.0-1069.78
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1069-fips - 4.15.0-1069.78
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2053-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2053.55
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2053-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2053.55
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2035-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2035.39

Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
